member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.EventDataEntry

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.AllCalls
member.summary: Query AST node representing the whole 'Calls' table. This is the source of all queries. Produces SELECT .. FROM .. in SQL.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.QueryNode
member.summary: Base class for nodes in the Query AST.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.QueryNode.BuildSql(System.Text.StringBuilder,ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SqlQueryContext)
member.summary: SQL construction documentation see SQLiteQueryProvider documentation.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.QueryNode.WrapSqlIntoNestedStatement(System.Text.StringBuilder,ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SqlQueryContext)
member.summary: Wraps the current SQL statement into an inner select, allowing to continue with "WHERE" queries even after ORDER BY or LIMIT.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.QueryNode.SqlAs(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Helper function that builds the text 'expression AS newName'

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.AllFunctions
member.summary: Query AST node representing the whole 'Functions' table. This is the source of all queries. Produces SELECT .. FROM .. in SQL.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.Filter
member.summary: Query node that filters the input using conditions. Produces WHERE or HAVING in SQL.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.Filter.Conditions
member.summary: List of conditions. The operator between these is AND.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.Limit
member.summary: Query node that limits the amount of data selected. Produces LIMIT in SQL.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.MergeByName
member.summary: Query node that represents the 'group by nameid and merge' operation. Produces SELECT ... GROUP BY .. in SQL.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.OptimizeQueryExpressionVisitor
member.summary:
Performs query optimizations. See the documentation on SQLiteQueryProvider for the list of optimizations being performed.
Nodes returned from 'Visit' can be assumed to be fully optimized (they won't contain any of the patterns described in the SQLiteQueryProvider optimization documentation).

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.OptimizeQueryExpressionVisitor.ReorderFilter(ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.Filter)
member.summary: Tries to combine nested filters; move 'MergeByName' nodes out of filter, if possible

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.OptimizeQueryExpressionVisitor.OptimizeFilter(ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.Filter)
member.summary: Optimizes the filter; but does not try to combine nested filter (etc.)

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SingleCall
member.summary: The SingleCall class is never instanciated; it only used to represent database rows inside expression trees.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SQLiteQueryProvider
member.summary:
"LINQ-To-Profiler" QueryProvider implementation for SQLiteCallTreeNode.
Input to a LINQ QueryProvider is a System.Linq.Expressions tree describing the query that should be executed.
Query execution is done as: 1. Partial evaluation 2. Translation of expression tree to QueryAst 3. Optimization of QueryAst 4. Execution of Queries (by converting them to SQL and running it on the DB) 5. Execution of remaining query using LINQ-to-Objects

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SQLiteQueryProvider.RunSQLIDList(System.String)
member.summary: Executes an SQL command that returns a list of integers.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SQLiteQueryProvider.OptimizeQuery(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Optimizes the query without executing it. Used for unit tests.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SQLiteQueryProvider.SafeExpressionImporter.AddConditionsToFilterList(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Linq.Expressions.LambdaExpression})
member.summary: Imports 'expr' and adds the imported conditions to 'filters'.
member.returns: True if the import was successful.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SQLiteQueryProvider.SafeExpressionImporter.forbiddenGlobChars
member.summary: The list of characters forbidden in GLOB arguments.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.Linq.SQLiteQueryProvider.SafeExpressionImporter.Import(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Imports an expresion.
member.returns: The imported expression; or null if the expression was not safe for import.

member.summary: Tests if expr is 'c.NameMapping'.

member.summary: Passed down the query tree to signalize that the ID list is required.

member.summary: The type of the table currently being accessed (the current FROM clause). Is 'None' when reading from an inner query.

member.summary: Passed up the query tree to signalize whether an ID list is present.

member.summary: No direct table

member.summary: Wraps to support lazy-loading and easy value collection. Stores additonal meta data such as min/max allowed value or unit of the values.

member.summary: Creates a new PerformanceCounterDescriptor.

member.summary: Creates a new PerformanceCounterDescriptor.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.GetProcessInstanceName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the perfmon process identifier for a process Id. If the process is not available (e. g. not running anymore) null is returned.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Reset
member.summary: Deletes all collected information.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Collect(System.String)
member.summary: Collects a new value. The default value is recorded if any error occurs, while attempting to collect a value.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of the performance counter.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Category
member.summary: Gets the category of the performance counter.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the performance counter.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Instance
member.summary: Gets the instance (perfmon process id) of the performance counter.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Computer
member.summary: Gets the computer the performance counter is executed on.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Values
member.summary: Gets a list of values collected by this performance counter.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.MinValue
member.summary: Gets the minimum allowed value collected by the performance counter. Returns null if there is no lower bound.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets the maximum allowed value collected by the performance counter. Returns null if there is no upper bound.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Unit
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the unit of the values collected.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.PerformanceCounterDescriptor.Format
member.summary: Gets the format string for display of the collected values.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider
member.summary: Base implementation for a ProfilingDataProvider.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.Close
member.summary: Closes and disposes the provider.
member.remarks: Using a closed provider results in an ObjectDisposedException. Calls that are active during the call to Close() will either throw an ObjectDisposedException or finish successfully.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.GetRoot(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the root-CallTreeNode for a range of datasets.
member.param: The index of the first dataset to return.
The index of the last dataset to return.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.GetMapping(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a name mapping for a given name id.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.SetProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a property consisting of a name-value pair. (e. g. version number) Setting a property to null will remove the property.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.GetProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a property identified by its name.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.GetAllCalls(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the list of all calls in a specified range of datasets.

member.summary: Returns the list of all functions called in a specified range of datasets.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.GetPerformanceCounters
member.summary: Returns the list of performance counters used in all datasets.

member.summary: Returns the list of all values collected by a performance counter identified by its index.

member.summary: Returns the list of all events for a dataset.

member.summary: Gets all datasets in the session.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.ProfilingDataProvider.ProcessorFrequency
member.summary: The processor speed read from the registry of the computer where the profiling session was created on. The processor frequency is measured in MHz.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode
member.summary: Provides a skeleton for implementing data-structure specific versions of CallTreeNodes.
member.remarks: All members of this class are thread-safe. However, calling members of this class might be unsafe when the data source ( or ) is concurrently disposed. See the documentation of the data source for details.

member.summary: Merges a collection of CallTreeNodes into one CallTreeNode, all valuess are accumulated.

member.summary: Returns a descendant of this node described by its absolute NodePath.

member.summary: Returns the NodePath of this CallTreeNode.

member.summary: Returns the NodePath of this CallTreeNode relative to the specified node.
member.remarks: This might not work properly for merged nodes.

member.summary: Creates the signature representation for the CallTreeNode. thread nodes will be represented by "Thread#" + their unmanaged thread id. All other nodes (except root nodes) have the representation: returntype MethodName(parameter1, parameter2, ...)

member.summary: Gets a reference to the name, return type and parameter list of the method.

member.summary: Gets the number of calls to the method represented by the CallTreeNode.

member.summary: Gets the number of calls to the method represented by the CallTreeNode.

member.summary: Gets whether this call is user code.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.IsActiveAtStart
member.summary: Gets whether the function call started in a previous data set that's not selected.

member.summary: Gets how many CPU cycles were spent inside this method, including sub calls.

member.summary: Gets how many CPU cycles were spent inside this method, excluding sub calls.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the method including namespace and class name.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.ReturnType
member.summary: Gets the return type of the method as string.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.IsThread
member.summary: Determines whether this node is a thread node.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.HasChildren
member.summary: Determines whether this node has chil

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a readonly list of the string representation of the parameters.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.TimeSpent
member.summary: Gets the time spent inside the method (including sub calls) in milliseconds.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.TimeSpentSelf
member.summary: Gets the time spent inside the method (excluding sub calls) in milliseconds.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Parent
member.summary: Gets a reference to the parent of this CallTreeNode.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Children
member.summary: Returns all children of the current CallTreeNode, sorted by order of first call.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Descendants
member.summary: Returns all descendants of this CallTreeNode.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.DescendantsAndSelf
member.summary: Returns all descendants of this CallTreeNode including itself.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Ancestors
member.summary: Returns all ancestors of this CallTreeNode.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.AncestorsAndSelf
member.summary: Returns all ancestors of this CallTreeNode including itself.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.CallTreeNode.Callers
member.summary: Returns a list of all CallTreeNodes that are callers of this node.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.IProfilingDataSet
member.summary: Represents a dataset from a profiling session.
member.remarks: All members of this class are thread-safe. However, calling members of this class might be unsafe when the data source ( or ) is concurrently disposed. See the documentation of the data source for details.

member.summary: Gets whether this dataset is the first dataset of a profiling run.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.IProfilingDataSet.RootNode
member.summary: Gets the root node of the dataset.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.IProfilingDataWriter
member.summary: Used to write profiling data to a format (e. g. SQLite DB, binary). Instance members of this interface are not thread-safe.

member.summary: Writes an unmanaged dataset.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase
member.summary: Stores recorded profiling data in a temporary file, which is deleted when the file database is closed. Instance members of this class are not thread-safe.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new TempFileDatabase.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.Close
member.summary: Closes the TempFileDatabase. After calling this method, the data recorded is lost, because the temporary file is deleted.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.GetWriter
member.summary: Creates a new Writer to allow writing access to the database.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.LoadDataSet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads a dataset into memory.
member.remarks: You can not load any datasets before all writers are closed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.WriteTo(ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.IProfilingDataWriter,System.Predicate{System.Double})
member.summary: Copies all data to a different writer.
member.param: Used to report the progress of writing all DataSets, returning false tells WriteTo to cancel the process.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes all unmanaged memory and files opened by the dataset.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.TempFileDatabase.NameMappings
member.summary: The list of NameMappings in the database.
member.remarks: NameMappings are held in memory and not written to the file.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Controller.Data.UnmanagedProfilingDataSet

member.summary: Maps a section of the file into virtual memory.
member.param: The start position in the file from where to start mapping.
The number of bytes to map into virtual memory.
member.returns: An UnmanagedMemory object representing the mapped memory. Dispose the UnmanagedMemory object to unmap the view.
member.remarks: This method may map more than the specified range when offset is not a multiple of SystemAllocationGranularity. In that case, the returned start pointer is an offset into the view, and is not aligned if offset is not aligned.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer
member.summary: A circular buffer residing in unmanaged memory. This class can be used to create communication streams in shared memory.
member.remarks: The performance isn't perfect, there's a problem that sometimes causes transmission with a fast writer to go like this: UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 33 (max-1) UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 1 UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 33 (max-1) UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 1 UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 33 (max-1) UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 1 UnmanagedCircularBuffer: write amount 9 Assume the buffer is full, and the reader read until the buffer wrap-around position. Then the writer will write to wrap-around - 1 (because we don't allow a completely full buffer - we couldn't distinguish it from a completely empty buffer). Then the reader will read some more bytes. Then the writer will write just one byte (to the wrap-around position). Either writer or reader should learn to read/write over the wrap-around position in a single operation to prevent 1 byte-writes from occurring so frequently. But this is only a problem when transmitting large amounts of data through a small buffer - making the buffer large enough also solves the problem.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.SynchronizationOverheadSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the buffer header.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.Create(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new circular buffer.
member.param: Position where the circular buffer should be created
Length of the circular buffer. Not the whole length is available for data, some space will be used for synchronization.
member.returns: NativeCircularBuffer object representing the circular buffer

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.CreateNew(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new AutoResetEvent using the random number generator.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.Open(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Opens on existing circular buffer.
member.param: Position of the circular buffer
member.returns: NativeCircularBuffer object representing the circular buffer

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.CreateReadingStream
member.summary: Constructs a reading stream for the circular buffer. A buffer may have only one reader!

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.CreateWritingStream
member.summary: Constructs a reading stream for the circular buffer. A buffer may have only one writer!

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the circular buffer.
member.param: Specifies whether the close method should wait for the active reader thread to exit. If you pass true, but there is no reader thread; the Close method will deadlock. If you pass false, but there is a reader thread; the reader thread will crash.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.ReadingStream
member.summary: Implements a stream reading a circular buffer in unmanaged memory.

member.summary: Constructs a UnmanagedCircularBufferReadingStream

member.summary: Implements a stream writing to a circular buffer in unmanaged memory.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer.WritingStream.#ctor(ICSharpCode.Profiler.Interprocess.UnmanagedCircularBuffer)
member.summary: Constructs a NativeCircularBufferWritingStream
